alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 3:05PM AKST until December 24 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FRONT WILL BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE HIGHWAYS... .Area of surface low pressure will track north towards south- central Alaska. The associated front will swing south to north over the panhandle. Cold air ahead of the front will bring snow to the northern Lynn Canal area. As warmer air slides north, snow switching to rain is likely by Saturday afternoon for Haines and Skagway. Farther up the highways near the border, moderate to heavy snow will last into Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 20 inches along the highways. Lighter amounts in Haines and Skagway. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway and Haines Borough and Klukwan, including the Haines and Klondike Highways. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Because of the switch from snow to rain, the city of Haines can expect snowfall amounts around 3 to 5 inches. Skagway can expect snowfall amounts around 1 to 3 inches. If the southerly push of warmer air arrives later than expected, the transition of snow to rain will be delayed, resulting in greater snowfall amounts for the cities and areas closer to sea level.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway
